content: sno cap hood by little quail a whimsical hood for setting out on a frosty winter s morning wear the hood up to keep ears warm or lower it when you just need the scarf super long scarf ends mean you can have fun wrapping this way and that tie them in a big bow or tuck them in the back for an extra layer of warmth pattern overview the sno cap hood is knit in brioche from end to end you will start by making a long skinny scarf when it has reached the desire length you ll start working brioche increases and decreases to form the hood the project is complete when the second end of the scarf is done ⊹ ۪ ˑ ִ ֗ ִ ۫ ˑ⋅˚₊‧ ୨୧ ‧₊˚ ⋅⊹ ۪ ˑ ִ ֗ ִ ۫ ˑ about this pattern this free pattern is a public version of my personal knitting notes and is untested your mileage may vary please make sure you re using the latest version of this pattern before you begin as this is a brioche knitting pattern you may see terminology you are unfamiliar with if you have not knit brioche before i recommend watching tutorials from purl soho no affiliation if you are confused yarn & needles ⊹ ۪ ˑ ִ ֗ ִ ۫ ˑ⋅˚₊‧ ୨୧ ‧₊˚ ⋅⊹ ۪ ˑ ִ ֗ ִ ۫ ˑ you can use any worsted weight wool yarn for this pattern try to hit gauge for abbreviations more accurate results - k knit - sl slip purlwise recommended needle us 7 4 5 mm - yf-sl1-yo yarn forward slip 1 yarn please use double pointed or circular over with yarn in front slip the next needles stitch purlwise bring the yarn over the slipped stitch to the back of the you may choose to use stitch markers work as you work - tbl through back loop - wyif with yarn in front gauge - brk brioche knit 4 x 4 or 10 x 10 cm swatch - b cdd brioche centered double knit in standard brioche decrease approximately 13 st x 26 r slip next 2 stitches together knit- wise slip next stitch knit-wise insert note on sizing left needle through all 3 stitches on this pattern is written for one size but the right needle yo & pull through as you can easily adjust it to fit differently if you like a normal knit stitch - b cdi brioche centered double to make the hood deeper front to increase back work a few more increases insert needle through the next followed by an equal number of decreases brioche stitch as if to knit yo & pull likewise for a narrower hood work through leaving the stitch on the left fewer increases and as many needle bring the yarn forward in decreases between the two needles and around to make the hood wider ear to ear to the back insert needle again into simply work additional row
